item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description: Brief Biography Christopher Hesh is an Early Specialization in Interventional Radiology (ESIR) resident physician in the Department of Radiology and Imaging Sciences at Emory University School of Medicine. His research focus is the development of image-guided therapeutics for solid tumors of childhood. Research Interests Interventional oncology; pediatric interventional radiology; image-guided therapeutics Education 2011 ~ 2016, Doctor of Medicine, University of Maryland School of Medicine 2009 ~ 2010, Post-Baccalaureate Premedical Program, Goucher College 2004 ~ 2008, Bacherlor of Arts, Anthroplogy & Sociology, Saint Louis University Clinical Training 2017 ~ 2021, Residency, Diagnostic Radiology (ESIR), Emory University School of Medicine, Department of Radiology & Imaging Sciences 2016 ~ 2017, Internship, Internal Medicine, Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center Honors & Awards Case Competition Winner, 2018 (Society of Interventional Radiology) Travel Scholarship, 2018 (Society of Interventional Oncology) Dr.
